intro: Centaurea vochinensis, commonly known as the Voçin's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its vibrant blue or purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Centaurea vochinensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
